responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Talkative? Blimey, I suppose I am. I mean, I've got a lot to say, especially when it comes to the people I care about, like Harry and Hermione. We've been through a lot together, and I've learned that sometimes it's just easier to say what's on your mind rather than keeping it all bottled up. So, yeah, I'd say I'm pretty chatty, especially when it comes to fighting Dark Magic or... or just trying to make sense of things, really.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't think I find fault with others that often. I mean, I've had my fair share of annoyances with Hermione, but that's just because we're mates and we push each other to be better. And when it comes to Harry, I'd do anything to support him – even if he's being a bit daft sometimes. I reckon I'm more likely to find fault in myself, to be honest – I'm always trying to live up to the others, especially Harry.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Blimey, I do my best, you know? I've had me share of dodgy situations, but I've always tried to come out on top. Whether it's sneaking around Hogwarts with Harry and Hermione or taking on the Dark Lord's followers as an Auror, I've learned to rely on me mates and me own wits to get the job done. So, yeah, I think I do a pretty thorough job, even if I do say so meself!

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not depressed or blue, I'm just... dealing with things, you know? Losin' people, facin' stuff, it's all a bit much sometimes. But I've got me mates, Harry and Hermione, and we stick together through all the tough times. We've been through so much, and we always seem to come out the other side. It's not always easy, but I reckon that's just life, innit?

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Ideas? Blimey, I think so! I mean, I'm not exactly the cleverest, but I've come up with a few things in my time. Like that platter I made for the ghosts at our party, or the time I helped Harry and Hermione with their little...adventures. I've also had some good ideas for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, like those pesky U-No-Poo joke pranks that drove Mum mad. And, of course, I've had a few good ideas in the heat of the moment, like when I helped the Aurors dodge the Death Eaters. So, yeah, I'd say I'm pretty good at coming up with new ideas, especially when it counts!

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Blimey, no, I'm not really reserved, am I? I mean, I've always been a bit of a loudmouth, especially when it comes to standing up for me mates. But, you know, there are times when I have to be brave, like when we were fighting against the Dark Lord, and I found out I could be pretty fierce when I needed to be.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I'm a pretty helpful and unselfish bloke, even if I do say so myself. I've been there for Harry through thick and thin, even when he's been a bit...distracted, you know? And I've stood by my mates, like Neville and Hermione, when they've needed me most. I reckon that's what friends are for, after all."

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Blimey, careless? Me? Well, I suppose I can be a bit...impulsive. You know, like the time I decided to have a go at the Whomping Willow with Harry. Or when I, uh, "accidentally" let the Hogwarts Express go a bit too fast on the track. (laughs nervously) But, I mean, that's just part of being a Weasley, right? We're always getting into trouble, one way or another.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really the relaxing type, to be honest. I get a bit... anxious, especially when it's about Harry and Hermione. But, you know, when it comes down to it, I reckon I handle stress pretty well. I mean, I've been in some pretty hairy situations, and I've always managed to... well, not exactly calm down, but, you know, keep my wits about me, I suppose.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm absolutely fascinated by loads of things! I mean, have you seen the way those ghosts drift through the party? It's like they're trying to tell us something, but we just can't quite hear it. And then there's the stuff we come up with in Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – I mean, who'd have thought that turning canaries out of a sweet treat would be a thing? The possibilities are endless, and that's what gets me going, you know?

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah, I'm full of energy all right! I mean, I've had my fair share of close calls and scary situations, but I've always managed to find a way to rally, you know? There's just something about being with my mates, like Harry and Hermione, that makes me feel like I can take on the Dark Lord himself."

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't go around looking for trouble, but I'm not one to back down from a fight when it's for the people I care about. You might say I've had my fair share of run-ins with the likes of Malfoy and Umbridge, and I've learned that standing up for what's right can sometimes lead to a bit of a quarrel. But I reckon that's just part of being a true friend, don't you?

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I'm a pretty reliable worker, to be honest. I mean, I've been there for Harry and Hermione through thick and thin, and I've helped out in some pretty tricky situations, like that time we were fighting the Dementors at Hogwarts. I'm not always the most confident bloke, but when it counts, I'm there, and I'll do whatever it takes to help me mates and stand up for what's right.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, tense? Yeah, I get that way when it counts. Like when Harry's in danger, or we're up against the Dark Lord's lot. I can feel it in my gut, this... this knot that just won't untie. It's hard to explain, but it's like my whole body's on high alert, waiting for the worst to happen, and it's a right frightening feeling, if I'm honest.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not exactly the thinking type, but I've always relied on my mates to help me out in tricky situations. Harry's the one who's usually got the clever ideas, but I've learned that sometimes being quick on your feet and knowing when to act can be just as useful as being a deep thinker. I mean, I've managed to get us out of some pretty tight spots just by being brave and doing what feels right."

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm always up for a good time, and I get a bit carried away, but it's all worth it when it's for the people I care about. You know, I've had my fair share of amazing moments – like when I was being a bit of a hero, and Fleur kissed me on the cheek, or when I was cheering Harry on at the Quidditch finals. I reckon enthusiasm just kind of comes naturally to me when I'm with my mates, and we're all having a good time together.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: I'd say I've got a pretty forgiving nature, yeah. I mean, I've made my mistakes, and I've had mates stick by me even when I wasn't exactly being brilliant. Like that time I was going out with Lavender and realized I was better off without her – it was a weird feeling, but it made me realize what's truly important.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm a bit of a mess, to be honest. I mean, I've got a good heart, but organizing stuff... it's not really my thing. I'm more of a 'fly by the seat of my pants' kind of bloke. But when it counts, I usually manage to get things sorted, don't I?"

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I worry a lot, you know? Mum's always been worried about me, and I don't blame her, I've had me share of close calls, especially with Harry and Hermione. It's not just them, though – I worry about everyone, even the blokes in Slytherin, I reckon.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Blimey, I've got an imagination that's always on the go! I mean, think about it - I've had all these wild ideas, like that time George and I tried to make a banquet platter for the ghosts, or when we came up with the most brilliant plan to catch those Death Eaters. And it's not just the big stuff, either - even just daydreaming about Quidditch or sneaking into the kitchens to get a bite of treacle fudge... my mind's always racing with possibilities.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Blimey, quiet? Me? I don't think so! I'm usually the one crackin' jokes or gettin' us into some kind of trouble. Unless I'm with Harry and Hermione, then I'm just happy to be along for the ride. You know, I'm not exactly the most confident bloke, but when it counts, I'm there for me mates, even if I don't say much.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not exactly the most trusting person. I mean, I've had my fair share of doubts and worries about Harry and Hermione, especially when things get really tough. But, when it counts, I always try to have faith in them. I guess you could say I'm a bit of a worrier, but when it comes to my best mates, I know I can rely on them, even if they can be a bit...distracting sometimes.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? I reckon I'm more of a 'distracted by friends and situations' kind of bloke. I mean, I've been in some right tricky spots, but I've always managed to come out on top, thanks to Harry and Hermione. It's not that I'm lazy, it's just that I've got better things to do than sit around all day, like help my mates in a tight spot or try to make a bit of sense of the wizarding world.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Emotionally stable? Blimey, I'm not sure I'm always the most... composed, but when it comes to my friends, I reckon I'm pretty rock-solid. I mean, I get anxious and stuff, but when it's down to it, I know what's important – keeping Harry and Hermione safe, and standing up for what's right.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I'm quite inventive, you know! I mean, I've come up with some pretty wild ideas over the years, like that Canary Cream that turned into birds in the shop - it was a right mess, but it was brilliant! And, of course, there was the time I helped those Aurors during the Calamity, teaching them some dodgy moves to avoid getting hit. It's not always easy, but I like to think on me feet and come up with something clever.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I've got a bit of both, to be honest. I mean, I've been in some right tricky situations, and when it counts, I try to stand up for what's right. It's not always easy, but I've got mates like Harry and Hermione who push me to be braver than I thought I was. I reckon that's what being assertive is all about – not being afraid to speak up and fight for what matters, even if it's scary."

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really sure what you mean by "cold and aloof." I'm a bit of a emotional mess, to be honest. I get all worked up about me mates and the things that matter, but sometimes I don't know how to deal with...well, with people who don't get it. I mean, like Hermione, she's always so confident and clever, it can be a bit intimidating, but at the same time, I admire her for it. But, yeah, I suppose I'm not exactly the calm and collected type. I'm more of a "fly by the seat of me pants" kind of bloke.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I do persevere until the task is finished. I mean, think about all the times we've had to save the day, haven't we? Whether it's sneaking into Gringotts or stopping You-Know-Who, I've always managed to find the courage to see things through, even when it feels like the odds are against us. It's not just about me, though - it's about standing up for what's right and fighting for the people I care about, like Harry and Hermione.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I can be moody. I mean, it's not always easy bein' the sidekick, even if you're the best one, you know? Sometimes I feel like I'm just...well, in the way, or somethin', but when it counts, I'm there for me mates, and that's all that matters, right?

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I reckon I value artistic and aesthetic experiences, yeah. You see, there's more to life than just fighting Dark Lords or Quidditch matches – although, those are pretty important too. But, really, it's the little moments that count, like Fleur's kindness after the Battle of Hogwarts or the twins' madcap inventions at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Even the blurry memories of my wedding day with Hermione, the love I share with my family, and the joy of watching my kids grow up – that's what it's all about, if you ask me.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I can be a bit...inhibited, especially when it comes to, you know, the big stuff. Like when I thought Harry was possessed or that Sirius was a threat, it was really hard for me to, you know, talk about it. But, with Harry and Hermione around, I feel like I can be a bit more...open, I suppose. It's funny, I'm usually the one who's a bit more, uh, outspoken, but when it comes to things that really matter, I tend to get a bit...shut down, like.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm a pretty considerate bloke, especially when it comes to me mates. I mean, I've been there for Harry and Hermione through thick and thin, and we've shared some real dodgy moments, haven't we? I reckon being kind is just part of being a good friend, and I've been lucky to have some top-notch mates like that.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: "Efficient? Blimey, I'm not sure that's really my thing, to be honest. I mean, I've had my moments, like that time I figured out those dodgy Auror defensive moves or came up with a plan to sneak into Gringotts. But often, it's just a case of winging it and hoping for the best, you know? Hermione's always the one who's got the clever ideas and keeps us on track, but I like to think I can hold my own when it comes to coming up with a plan... even if it's not always the most... shall we say, 'efficient' one."

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the calmest bloke in tense situations, if I'm being honest. I get worried, and my mind starts racing with all the what-ifs and how-can-we-save-the-day thoughts. But, you know, when it comes down to it, I always try to keep a level head and do what needs doing to protect my mates – especially Harry and Hermione. They're the ones who always seem to know what to do, but I'm not one to back down, either!

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Honestly, I'm not a fan of routine work. I mean, I know some people like it, but I need a bit of excitement and unpredictability to keep me going. You know, like when Harry, Hermione, and I were on our quest to defeat Voldemort - we never knew what was around the next corner, and that's what made it all so thrilling. Routine just isn't really my thing, to be honest.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a bit of a mix when it comes to being outgoing and sociable. I mean, I've always been a bit more... reserved, I suppose, especially when it comes to making friends. But, you know, when I've got the right people around me – like Harry and Hermione – I can be really chatty and just go with the flow. And, of course, when we're facing danger together, I tend to come out of my shell a bit more, just because we've got to stick together, you know?

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I can be a bit...short with people when they get on my nerves. Like when Hermione's always sorting Harry out and I feel like I'm getting left behind, you know? But it's not really that I'm being rude, it's just...I don't know, I feel a bit like I'm stuck in the shadows, and sometimes I let it get to me.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Blimey, plans? Well, I suppose I do make 'em, but they're not always the most... organized, if you know what I mean. But, when it counts, I've always managed to follow through. Like the time we stood up for Buckbeak – I was dead set on getting him freed, no matter what. Or when we were breaking into Gringotts, I knew I had to see it through for Harry's sake. I reckon, when it comes to the people I care about, I can usually muster up the courage to see things through, even if it gets a bit hairy.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Blimey, I get nervous, all right. There's just so much at stake, you know? I mean, I'm always worried about Harry, and Hermione's always pushing herself to be better, and then there's the Dark Lord... it's a lot to handle. I'd say I get pretty anxious, especially when it feels like the whole wizarding world is against us.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: I'm a big believer in living in the moment and going with the flow, you know? I don't always have time to sit around thinking too much about things, but when I do, it's usually when I'm with my mates, like Harry and Hermione, or when I'm playing Quidditch. Those are the moments when everything just feels right, and I feel like I can conquer the world.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: I've got a few artistic interests, you know. George and I had a bit of fun with this platter we made, trying to please the ghosts that haunt the Burrow. We added some treats, hoping they'd enjoy it. It's all about finding the lighter side of things, even in the darker times.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Cooperate with others? Yeah, I suppose I do. I mean, I've always had Harry and Hermione's backs, no matter what. We've been through thick and thin together, and I'd do anything to help them out. It's just what friends do, innit? We work together, rely on each other, and make sure everyone's safe and sound.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I'd say I can get pretty easily distracted. You know, it's not that I'm not paying attention, it's just that my mind's always racing with all the things that could go wrong or what I could be doing to help Harry and Hermione. Like that time Xenophilius Lovegood's trap nearly caught me, I was torn between following Dumbledore's plan and chasing after the mysterious Hallows. It's hard to focus when you've got danger lurking around every corner, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: "Blimey, art, music, and literature aren't exactly my strong suits, but I've had me share of weird and wonderful experiences that've taught me a thing or two. Like that time I helped the Aurors dodge those Death Eaters, or when I convinced the Statute of Secrecy Task Force to stand up to the Dark Arts – it's not exactly poetry or painting, but it's me way of making a difference. I reckon being brave, loyal, and clever in the face of danger is a bit of art in its own right, don't you?"
